pullRequest.body:
We add various theorems that assert the spectrum of a diagonal matrix is the range of the diagonal viewed as a function.

Co-Authored by @j-loreaux

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [0561c3b868](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13837/commits/0561c3b86814b28f42c105a0a2aee546f7cad1cc)

#### Import changes

No significant changes to the import graph

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ hasEigenvalue_toLin'_diagonal_iff`
`+ hasEigenvalue_toLin_diagonal_iff`
`+ hasEigenvector_toLin'_diagonal`
`+ hasEigenvector_toLin_diagonal`
`+ spectrum_diagonal`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>

Ah, cool. To clarify, we want the standard basis version here, right?
Should I provide versions for toEuclideanLin as well?

On Sun, Jun 23, 2024, 10:51 AM Jireh Loreaux ***@***.***>
wrote:

> ***@***.**** commented on this pull request.
> ------------------------------
>
> In Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/Eigenspace/Matrix.lean
> <https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13837#discussion_r1650092042>
> :
>
> > +lemma hasEigenvector_toLin_basis_diagonal (d : n â†’ R) (i : n) (b : Basis n R M) :
> +    Module.End.HasEigenvector (toLin b b (diagonal d)) (d i) (b i) := by
> +  constructor
> +  Â· refine mem_eigenspace_iff.mpr ?left.a
> +    simp only [diagonal, Pi.basisFun_apply, toLin'_apply, mulVec_stdBasis_apply, transpose_apply,
> +      of_apply, Pi.smul_apply, LinearMap.stdBasis_apply', smul_eq_mul, mul_ite, mul_one, mul_zero]
> +    all_goals simp_all
> +  Â· exact Basis.ne_zero b i
> +
> +/--  Standard basis vectors are eigenvectors of any associated diagonal linear operator. -/
> +lemma hasEigenvector_toLin'_diagonal (d : n â†’ R) (i : n) :
> +    Module.End.HasEigenvector (toLin' (diagonal d)) (d i) (Pi.basisFun R n i) :=
> +  hasEigenvector_toLin_basis_diagonal (d : n â†’ R) (i : n) (b := Pi.basisFun R n)
> +
> +/-- Eigenvalues of a diagonal linear operator are the diagonal entries. -/
> +lemma hasEigenvalue_toLin'_diagonal_iff (d : n â†’ R) {Î¼ : R} :
>
> Actually, toLin' is just the standard basis version, but with the max
> norm. toEuclideanLin is the PiLp 2 version.
>
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13837#discussion_r1650092042>,
> or unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AOJJJTRBKP74GILZ5JC4TVTZI3OHDAVCNFSM6AAAAABJKQ6XSSVHI2DSMVQWIX3LMV43YUDVNRWFEZLROVSXG5CSMV3GSZLXHMZDCMZUGI4TOMJYG4>
> .
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.Message ID:
> ***@***.***>
>
maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by j-loreaux.

Thanks!

bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9702092132/job/26777151027)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9702092132/job/26777151224)
This is probably sensible as a `simp` lemma.

style nit:
```suggestion
variable {R : Type*} [Field R] {n : Type*} [DecidableEq n] [Fintype n]
```

Is this also true for something like
```suggestion
    Module.End.HasEigenvector (Matrix.toLin b b (diagonal d)) (d i) (b i) := by
```
for some `b : Basis _ _ _`? If so, it would be good to have both versions, preferably with one proof using the other.
I'll look into this. Thanks!
This is the first mention of `Matrix` in this file; perhaps that means this content would be better in a new `EigenSpace/Matrix.lean` file?
@eric-wieser : Should I create this new file and move the result as part of this PR, or should I handle this in another PR? (I'm still trying to get the hang of this!)

Yes, just make the new file and move this result into it as part of this PR. Generally, I would recommend basing what should constitute a separate PR in terms of semantically / mathematically distinct content (although there can be exceptions to this).

On a separate note: the `b : Basis _ _ _` from the other comment above probably should also apply here.
Probably `basis` doesn't need to be in the name.
Yeah, I wasn't too sure about this. Do you think this is a case where one of these is given a prime and the other isn't? I'm not really sure of a good name for this result...
This should have a `toLin` generalization.

Ah! I just learned something new. So, `toLin` is the general basis version, and `toLin'` is the `PiLp 2` version? 

Thanks for the clarification on this. (I assume this was what your previous suggestion about basis _ _ _ was referring to?)
Actually, `toLin'` is just the standard basis version, but with the max norm. `toEuclideanLin` is the `PiLp 2` version.

:golfing:
```suggestion
    Module.End.HasEigenvector (toLin b b (diagonal d)) (d i) (b i) :=
  âŸ¨mem_eigenspace_iff.mpr <| by simp [diagonal], Basis.ne_zero b iâŸ©
```

Lean can infer the arguments here
```suggestion
  hasEigenvector_toLin_diagonal ..
```

I don't think we really want `M` explicit here. Notice also that we generally group `Type` arguments at the beginning.
```suggestion
variable {R n M : Type*} [Field R] [DecidableEq n] [Fintype n]
```
Neat. I didn't know that, but it does make the most sense. Thanks!

You have this namespace open
```suggestion
    HasEigenvector (toLin b b (diagonal d)) (d i) (b i) := by
```

```suggestion
    HasEigenvector (toLin' (diagonal d)) (d i) (Pi.basisFun R n i) :=
```
I don't understand this suggestion, actually. This result isn't about `Pi.basisFun`. Is this the right place for the suggestion?
Ah I think I see. Both of these apply to the result below...
I think only the last result needs `R` to be a field. The rest hold under weaker assumptions. Please try to minimize the assumptions you need on `R` by changing them per theorem as needed.
Cool. Will do this first thing tomorrow. Thanks!
Can you also adjust the docstring accordingly?
Certainly! I'll do this now...

I don't think we need all of these
```suggestion
eigenspace, eigenvector, eigenvalue, spectrum, matrix
```

No need for `by exact`, and Lean can infer the other arguments besides the basis:
```suggestion
    HasEigenvalue (toLin' (diagonal d)) Î¼ â†” âˆƒ i, d i = Î¼ :=
  hasEigenvalue_toLin_diagonal_iff _ _ <| Pi.basisFun R n
```

:golfing:
```suggestion
  rw [â† AlgEquiv.spectrum_eq (toLinAlgEquiv <| Pi.basisFun R n), â† hasEigenvalue_iff_mem_spectrum]
```

```suggestion
variable {R n M : Type*} [DecidableEq n] [Fintype n]
```
Shoot! I keep doing this!!!!
I wouldn't create a section for one result, just add this hypothesis to the lemma
Again, don't use `variable` for one declaration, just add the hypothesis to the lemma.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: the spectrum of a diagonal matrix is the range of the diagonal

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat :  define `ContinuousFunctionalCalculus` Instance for Hermitian Matrices over an RCLike Field
